content.description: Sit with left hand on crimp and right in sidepull pocket gain your balance and make move to jug half way up and reach for the V shaped crack hold and finish straight up
content.location: On the Entrance boulder see pics

content.description: Sit start with left hand on a low large sidepull rail and right high about a foot above that on a smaller sidepull. Climb up and left, topping out on the far left side of the boulder.This probably goes without saying, but the big pieces of rock lodged into the side of this boulder are not part of the climb.
content.location: The left side of the large Umbrella boulder.

content.description: Stand start on the large jugs at about chest height and climb straight up through some really awesome crimpy holds on the slab.
content.location: On the right side of the Turtlehead boulder.

content.description: Start under the roof on the far right side of the Parasol boulder using anything you want in the large cluster of holds. I use one of the pockets for my right hand and the undercling/pinch for my left, but I'm guessing there are other functional variations. Climb straight up the face on hard to use sloper crimps. The grade and rating are a guess. The bottom half is really cool but I haven't figured out the top yet.
content.location: On the far right side of the Parasol boulder.

content.description: Sit with left hand on Sundial start hold and right hand on arete jug.  Make moves up arete to gain top edge and traverse left along top edge and finish same as Sundial.
content.location: Sundial boulder

content.description: Sit start on low edge and reach right hand for crimp on face and move up and left through crimps to high point of boulder (don’t use top edge until last hold at top)
content.location: On small boulder below the “Turtle’s Head” boulder

content.description: Sit on jugs reach for undercling and aim up and right to ledge and climb the squeeze arete to top
content.location: On entrance boulder see pics

content.description: Sit start matched on big sloper at the lip with a heel hook out left. Climb up using whatever you can. There are some crimps on the face and some good holds on the arete.
content.location: On the far right side of the Little Umbrella boulder.

content.description: Start near the middle of the boulder on good holds (see picture) and traverse right past the point before topping out.The bottom level of this boulder is off. It's pretty obvious what's off and what's on since the bottom section is basically just the ground, and is clearly separate from the middle and the top sections.
content.location: This is the only line on the Slopers Cabrón boulder, which is the last boulder at the Umbrella boulders.

content.description: Sit start under obvious crack and use edges or hand jams to the top
content.location: On north side of the Turtlehead boulder

content.description: Sit start matched in the jug in the middle of the scoop (same as Patio Drive-By) and climb straight out and slightly left to gain the jug ledge in the middle of the boulder. Climb up the center of the face on good holds, or use whatever feels easiest to get to the top.
content.location: On the far left side of the Turtlehead boulder.

content.description: Sit start on large jug in the middle of the scoop and climb out and right. Once you get to the jug shelf, top out at whatever point is easiest. FA shared the same topout as Patio Swing.
content.location: Around the far left side of the Turtlehead boulder.

content.description: Sit start on a huge jug and a good right hand sidepull and climb up the right side of the overhanging face using good holds the whole way to the top.
content.location: Right side of the face of the Parasol boulder

content.description: Sit start on jugs in the middle of the face. Climb up and left and mantle up the left side of the boulder.
content.location: On the boulder.

content.description: Sit start on lowest possible jug and climb straight up the arete.
content.location: This is the right arete of the large Umbrella boulder

content.description: Sit under lowball small roof and climb jugs to top (low part of rock is off see pic for start beta)
content.location: Near walk off of Turtlehead boulder

content.description: Sit start in cluster of holds underneath the arete and climb out the roof and up the slabby face just right of the arete. The initial moves go slightly left but you end up moving up and right once you get to the face.
content.location: To the right of the arete on the Parasol boulder.

content.description: Sit start on slopers (see picture) and climb the obvious line of holds up and right, using the slopey arete to topout.
content.protection: Pads, maybe a spotter if you have one handy.
content.location: On the slightly overhanging face of the Death Dealer Boulder.On the approach to the Umbrellas, as you switchback left from the Archers fork trail onto the smaller climbers trail, this problem will be facing you on the left side of the trail.

content.description: Sit start on undercling rail under the short roof. Climb straight out the roof using decent holds, then work your way up through a couple of some small crimps and a big heel hook, making a massive move off the crimps for the top.
content.location: The farthest left line on the Parasol boulder.

content.description: Sit start (same as the DC Proj) on undercling rail left of the crack and traverse right until you get to the large protruding overhanging face. Take the small shallow holds up to the juggy rail halfway up the boulder then traverse right all the way to the right arete. Top out using the juggy stuff on top of the right arete. There are many variations possible, but this is the longest I could find and the most obvious (path of least resistance) on the boulder.A more direct line could go using the slopers above the left arete, but doesn't seem worth the risk. If you fall from the top, you will have your back scratched pretty hard, and it probably won't even feel good.
content.protection: Pads. The top is probably V3 or V4. Just don't blow it.
content.location: On the Parasol boulder

content.description: This is an amazing collection of overhanging boulders hence the name the Umbrella boulders!  It sits directly off the Archers fork trail and has an easy approach 5 or so minutes!  Several stand alone boulders provide a wide range of grades and styles.  Possibly some of the hardest lines exist here just waiting for ascents!  However the mid range grades abound here as well with several really good lines.  The quality of the rock seems to be some of the best in the “Wayne” so come out and play!!!
